original: Bohlin, John Rupert, överlärare, Borås, f. 27/3/94 i Borås av P. J. B. o. Josefina Andersson. G. 23 m. Elisabeth Linder. Barn: Anders f. 25, Kerstin 27, Bengt 31. — Stud:ex. i Borås 13, folkskoll :ex. i Strängnäs 14. Folkskoll. i Skövde 16-20, i Borås fr. 20, överlär. v. Norrby folksk. sed. 39. Ordf. i Boråskrets, av S. A. F. 32- 46, i fp iok:avd. i Borås fr. 38, i säll-sk. Gamla boråsare fr. 44, led. av stadsfullm. fr. 38, lär:kår. repr. i Borås folksk :styr. fr. 38.
translated: Bohlin, John Rupert, head teacher, Borås, born March 27, 1894 in Borås to P. J. B. and Josefina Andersson. Married on June 23 to Elisabeth Linder. Children: Anders born in 1925, Kerstin in 1927, Bengt in 1931. He passed his studentexamen (high school) in Borås in 1913, and a certification for teaching in elementary school in Strängnäs in 1914. He worked as an elementary school teacher in Skövde from 1916-1920, in Borås since 1920, and as a head teacher at Norrby elementary school since 1939. He was the chairman of the Borås branch of the Swedish Teachers Association (S. A. F.) from 1932-1946, in the Liberal Youth Association (fp iok) of Borås since 1938, in the society of old residents of Borås since 1944, a member of the city council since 1938, and a representative for the teachers' council in Borås since 1938.

structured.name: John Rupert Bohlin

memberOf.name: Society of Old Residents of Borås

structured.description: John Rupert Bohlin (born March 27, 1894 in Borås) was a head teacher who worked at Norrby Elementary School starting in 1939. He passed his studentexamen (high school) in Borås in 1913 and received certification to teach in elementary school in Strängnäs in 1914. He worked as an elementary school teacher in Skövde from 1916-1920 and in Borås starting in 1920. Bohlin was the chairman of the Borås branch of the Swedish Teachers Association (S. A. F.) from 1932-1946, a member of the Liberal Youth Association (FP IOK) of Borås since 1938, a member of the Society of Old Residents of Borås since 1944, a member of the city council since 1938, and a representative for the teachers' council in Borås since 1938.
